page.title: 08History of Locks Heath.
page.content: From{1066-1222},the area encompassing the parish of Locks Heath was owned by the Crown.In{1222},Henry III gave the land,and its manor, to the Bishop of Winchester.He demanded that the area should provide all food and provisions for the newly founded Titchfield Abbey.After the dissolution in {1540},the lands passed to successive owners although the local people were still allowed their common rights. In{1866}an Act of Parliament allowed for the enclosure of much of the land. Only the rich could afford the Â£3000 needed to buy a plot.They quickly established small-holdings growing fruits and vegetables for the markets. As roads improved, the markets grew larger and further afield.Soon labourers were needed to work the fields.Many settled and made Locks Heath their home.
